bestBHT.bht: The connection established by the Holy Spirit in Mark 12:36 between the Psalms and the words of David is profound. As David spoke under the inspiration of the Holy Spirit, he acknowledged Christ as his Lord, affirming His exaltation to sit at God's right hand. This reference to Psalm 110:1 is of great significance, as it is frequently cited in the New Testament. It signifies the completion of Christ's work in salvation and illustrates the Father's affection and honor bestowed upon Him in His humanity.

John Gill: This is a proof, that David did call Christ his Lord; and that he called him so in spirit; since these words were delivered by him under the inspiration of the Holy Spirit."
The passage relates to what God the Father said to Christ, when being risen from the dead, he ascended on high, and entered into the most holy place.

He bid him sit down at his right hand, as having done the work of man's salvation, he was sent about, to full satisfaction; and as a mark of affection to him, and honour conferred upon him in the human nature.

It signifies the completion of Christ's work in salvation and showcases the Father's deep affection and honor for Him in His humanity.
